Sat, 15 Jun 2024 22:00:00 +0000 Jazz, or Ra, Remi-Samuels repeatedly struck her partner of 17 years with a claw hammer leaving him with two gashes, 4cm to 5cm long, on his forehead. Photo / Getty Images
Ethan Simon pleads guilty to stabbing two young Burger King employees, 16 and 17, in Takanini, Auckland https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/ethan-simon-pleads-guilty-to-stabbing-two-young-burger-king-employees-16-and-17-in-takanini-auckland/ 5ZIVGNU45NHT3K7GXUUVC73KEU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/crime/ethan-simon-pleads-guilty-to-stabbing-two-young-burger-king-employees-16-and-17-in-takanini-auckland/ 5ZIVGNU45NHT3K7GXUUVC73KEU/ Craig Kapitan“I want the money. Give me the money or I’m going to stab him,' Ethan Simon told staff. Sun, 16 Jun 2024 00:00:00 +0000 The Burger King franchise in Takanini, South Auckland where two young employees were stabbed is now permanently closed. Photo / Google Maps
Worse than recession - have we hit stagflation? - Liam Dann https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/liam-dann-worse-than-recession-have-we-hit-stagflation/JH23EHR6C5DUFNTJ7SIGUSA4XE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/liam-dann-worse-than-recession-have-we-hit-stagflation/JH23EHR6C5DUFNTJ7SIGUSA4XE/ Liam DannOPINION: Is New Zealand getting stuck in the worst possible economic trap? Sat, 15 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 The stagflation of the 1970s - when both unemployment and inflation were high - was widely seen as discrediting the idea of a Phillips curve. Illustration / Anna Crichton
Three people injured, man arrested after allegedly driving car into group in Ponsonby https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ Three-people-injured-man-arrested-after-allegedly-driven-car-into-group-in-ponsonby/D7ZBECIO5VCGNA6D6EBWSXDTUA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ Three-people-injured-man-arrested-after-allegedly-driven-car-into-group-in-ponsonby/D7ZBECIO5VCGNA6D6EBWSXDTUA/ Isaac DavisonThree people were injured in the incident and a man was arrested at the scene. Ponsonby shooting: Police investigate whether revolver found in Lake Taupō was murder weapon https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ponsonby-shooting-police-investigate-whether-revolvers-found-in-lake-taupo-were-murder-weapon/L6EQI5GKGFHQXAGRSIZHWHXHDE/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ponsonby-shooting-police-investigate-whether-revolvers-found-in-lake-taupo-were-murder-weapon/L6EQI5GKGFHQXAGRSIZHWHXHDE/ George Block, Jared SavageThey are cut-down Alfa Carbines, which have fast become the favoured gun for gang members. Sat, 15 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Hone Kay-Selwyn, who opened fire on Ponsonby Rd on May 5, 2024 killing Robert Sidney Horne, poses with a pistol and a wad of cash. Police have now found two pistols they believe could have been used in the killing in Lake Taupo. Photo / Supplied
Tom Phillips manhunt: Ōtorohanga residents on police shift to focus on King Country town https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tom-phillips-manhunt-otorohanga-residents-on-police-shift-to-focus-on-king-country-town/UO4WU7NGI5D3BMOCXRPVDKIBAA/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/tom-phillips-manhunt-otorohanga-residents-on-police-shift-to-focus-on-king-country-town/UO4WU7NGI5D3BMOCXRPVDKIBAA/ Cherie HowieResident’s heartfelt message for missing kids' mum after she showed him photo of trio. Sat, 15 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Wanted man Tom Phillips has evaded capture since disappearing with his three young kids, from left, Ember, Jayda and Maverick in December 2021. This month, police offered an $80,000 reward for information leading to the safe recovery of the children.
MPs’ accommodation allowances need to change because voters are losing respect - Heather du Plessis-Allan https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mps-accommodation-allowances-need-to-change-because-voters-are-losing-respect-heather-du-plessis-allan/LOCPCCNSUNCOVFRHBYE6GWVPXM/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/mps-accommodation-allowances-need-to-change-because-voters-are-losing-respect-heather-du-plessis-allan/LOCPCCNSUNCOVFRHBYE6GWVPXM/ Heather du Plessis-AllanOPINION: Parliament can change the rules if it wants to. It just doesn’t want to. Sat, 15 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 National Party MP Tim Costley has been outed for taking the money to pay for his Wellington apartment when his family home is 58km up the road in Ōtaki.
Reed Myers liquidation: Home buyers fear for $175,000 deposit on Auckland townhouse https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/reed-myers-liquidation-home-buyers-lose-175000-deposit-on-auckland-townhouse/ARXVC7NHTFFGTHSA2TEHBBHYBU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/reed-myers-liquidation-home-buyers-lose-175000-deposit-on-auckland-townhouse/ARXVC7NHTFFGTHSA2TEHBBHYBU/ Ben LeahyThe Iqbal family believe they're unlikely to get anything back for their $175,000 deposit. Sat, 15 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Syed Khurram Iqbal, here with wife Syeda Narjis Khurram and daughters Syeda Raneeya Batool and Syeda Waneeya Batool Naqvi, is distraught at delays and the possible loss of a $175,000 deposit for an Auckland home.
